1.text: To man the dispositions of the heart, and the answer of the tongue from Jehovah.

2.text: All the ways of man are clean in his eyes, and Jehovah tried the spirits.

3.text: Roll to Jehovah thy works, and thy purposes shall be established.

4.text: Jehovah made all to his purpose, and also the unjust for the day of evil.

5.text: Every one lifted up of heart an abomination to Jehovah: and hand to hand, shall not be unpunished.

6.text: By mercy and truth iniquity shall be expiated: and in the fear of Jehovah a departing from evil.

7.text: The ways of a man being accepted of Jehovah also he will make his enemies friends with him.

8.text: Good a little with justice above abundance of increase with no judgment.

9.text: The heart of man will purpose his ways, and Jehovah will prepare his steps.

10.text: Divining upon the lips of the king: his mouth will not transgress in judgment.

11.text: Weighing and balances of judgment are to Jehovah, and his work all the stones of the bag.

12.text: An abomination of kings to do injustice: for in justice shall the throne be prepared.

13.text: Lips of justice the acceptance of kings; and he will love the word of the upright.

14.text: The king’s wrath, messengers of death: and a wise man shall expiate it.

15.text: In the light of the king’s face is life, and his acceptance as the cloud of the latter rain.

16.text: The obtaining of wisdom how good above gold and the obtaining of understanding to be chosen above silver.

17.text: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil: to watch his ways the guarding of his soul.

18.text: Pride before a breaking, and a spirit lifted up before a fall.

19.text: Good the cast down of spirit with the humble more than to divide the spoil with the proud.

20.text: He understanding in the word shall find good: and he trusting in Jehovah, he being happy.

21.text: He understanding shall call to the wise of heart: and sweetness of lips shall add knowledge.

22.text: The understanding of him possessing it is a fountain of life: and the instruction of the foolish is folly.

23.text: The heart of the wise shall attend to his mouth, and he shall add knowledge to his lips.

24.text: Words of pleasantness an, honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and healing to the bones.

25.text: There is a way straight before a man, and its latter state the ways of death.

26.text: The soul of him laboring, labored for himself; for his mouth urged upon him.

27.text: A man of Belial dug up evil, and upon his lips, as a burning fire.

28.text: A man of perverseness shall send forth strife: and a tale-bearer separates friends.

29.text: A man of violence will seduce his neighbor, and he caused him to go in a way not good.

30.text: Closing his eyes to purpose perverseness: biting his lips he completed evil.

31.text: Old age a crown of glorying, shall be found in the way of justice.

32.text: He slow to anger is, good above the strong; and, he ruling over his spirit above him taking a city,

33.text: In the bosom he shall, cast the lot; and from Jehovah all his judgment.
